clinical_study.brief_title: Elevated Stearoyl-CoA Desaturase-1 Expression Predicts the Disease Severity of Severe Acute Pancreatitis
clinical_study.official_title: Elevated Stearoyl-CoA Desaturase-1 Expression Predicts the Disease Severity and Clinical Outcomes of Severe Acute Pancreatitis

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, the investgatiors aimed to investigate the associations between serum levels of stearoyl-CoA desaturase-1（SCD-1） and the disease severity as well as the presence of adverse clinical events, such as local complications, organ failure, mortality and so on.In this prospective study, participants were divided into two groups based on serum SCD-1 concentration on admission and prospectively observe the disease severity and clinical outcomes of them.

primary_outcome.measure: the incidence rate of infected pancreatic necrosis

secondary_outcome.measure: the incidence rate of organ failure
secondary_outcome.description: the incidence rate of organ failure (transient or persistent)

secondary_outcome.measure: the incidence rate of local complications
secondary_outcome.description: acute peripancreatic fluid collections, pancreatic pseudocycts, acute necrotic collections and walled-off necrosis

study_pop.textblock: patients with the diagnosis of acute pancreatitis (Atlanta standard), abdominal pain occurred within one week of admission; we intended to include the severer cases (APACHEII score is more than 8 and Ranson score is greater than 3).

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of Department of Surgical Intensive Care Unit
